title: Smiley's Devil Fruit Reincarnation Foreshadowing
author: Reddit r/OnePiece community
theoryText: The revelation that Caesar fed a Devil Fruit to the H2S gas slime to create Smiley is important foreshadowing for how Devil Fruits can reincarnate. Some fans theorized that when Smiley 'dies', we might see the first on-screen reincarnation of a Devil Fruit, which could explain how Devil Fruits have persisted throughout history.
evidence: Caesar explains Smiley is a Devil Fruit user despite being made of gas
This is the first time we see a Devil Fruit fed to a non-living substance
Sets up questions about what happens when Smiley is defeated

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: This theory relates to events in upcoming episodes 599-600 where Smiley's fate is revealed

resolution: Later confirmed when Smiley's Devil Fruit reincarnates into a nearby apple in episode 600

title: Caesar's Connection to Vegapunk and Future Science Arc
author: One Piece Discussion Forums
theoryText: The flashback revealing Caesar's dismissal by Vegapunk suggests a deeper rivalry and hints at a future arc where Vegapunk plays a major role. Fans theorized that Caesar's illegal experiments and Vegapunk's government work represent two sides of the same scientific coin, and we'll eventually see Vegapunk as either an ally or antagonist.
evidence: Caesar's bitterness toward Vegapunk is clearly established
Both are shown to be brilliant but morally different scientists
Vegapunk has been mentioned multiple times but never appeared
Caesar's chemical weapon disaster shows what happens when science is unchecked

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory based only on information revealed up to episode 595

resolution: Eventually confirmed with Vegapunk's appearance in the Egghead arc, though full resolution is ongoing

title: Luffy and Law's Alliance Dynamics
author: MangaHelpers Forum Users
theoryText: Episode 595 perfectly encapsulates the fundamental incompatibility between Luffy and Law's approaches. Fans theorized that this alliance would be defined by Law's careful plans constantly being disrupted by Luffy's impulsive actions, but somehow still succeeding due to Luffy's unpredictable strength. The theory suggested their alliance would last much longer than a single arc.
evidence: Law's frustration at Luffy's loud entrance
The contrast between Law's stealth approach and Luffy's direct assault
Both achieve their goals through completely different methods
Their dynamic mirrors their different philosophies as pirates

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory relates to the extended alliance through Dressrosa and beyond

resolution: Confirmed throughout Punk Hazard and Dressrosa arcs, with the alliance lasting much longer than initially expected
